revised_title: Glycogen Accumulation and Development in Streptomyces coelicolor A3(2)
tldr: This study examines the influences of developmental genes on localized glycogen deposition in colonies of the mycelial prokaryote, Streptomyces coelicolor A3(2). Two phases of glycogen accumulation are detected, with phase I occurring in hyphae at the air-agar interface region and phase II in aerial hyphal tips during sporulation. The findings suggest that glycogen synthesis and degradation may play a role in morphogenesis by influencing turgor pressure and that glycogen could be a major sink for carbon stored during sporulation.
